data.title: People/Characters: Isaac Newton
data.meta_description: LibraryThing catalogs yours books online, easily, quickly and for free.
data.text:
Description

2nd Lucasian Professor of Mathematics.

Sir Isaac Newton FRS (/ˈnjuːtən/;[6] 25 December 1642 – 20 March 1726/27) was an English physicist and mathematician (described in his own day as a "natural philosopher") who is widely recognised as one of the most influential scientists of all time and a key figure in the scientific revolution. His book Philosophiæ Naturalis Principia Mathematica (Mathematical Principles of Natural Philosophy), first published in 1687, laid the foundations for classical mechanics. Newton made seminal contributions to optics, and he shares credit with Gottfried Wilhelm Leibniz for the development of calculus.

Isaac Newton in Wikipedia

This is a general description. It is not a review.
